task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 150°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the full vertical extent of the main building at ~150° to estimate height, so I should tilt up to capture the roofline and upper floors.
The view is now pointed North and up, but the target building is to the South-East (~150°), so I should rotate right to align with ~150° while keeping the upward pitch to see the top.
To estimate height I need to see the building’s roofline and how many storeys it has, so I should tilt up while staying at 150° toward the building.
The camera again jumped to heading 0° while pitched up, so I need to rotate to 150° to face the target building and keep the upward pitch for roof visibility.
Rather than keep oscillating, I should answer from this view by estimating storeys: the main building appears about 3 floors plus roof (~3.5 m per floor).
